thread.title: Football: Bentonville sluggish in win over Springdale
thread.title_full: Football: Bentonville sluggish in win over Springdale

title: Football: Bentonville sluggish in win over Springdale
text:
Bentonville let a pair of early scoring opportunities slip away before finally taking advantage of a pair of Springdale High turnovers and proceeding to post a 28-3 victory over the Bulldogs in 7A-West Conference action. 
Bentonville 28, Springdale High 3 
Springdale^0^3^0^0^—^3 
Bentonville^0^14^7^7^—^28 
Second quarter 
Bent — Mays-Hunt 9 pass from Ford (Moehring kick), 10:49. 
Bent — Clark 14 run (Moehring kick), 2:29. 
Spring — FG Bautista 42, :31.9. 
Third quarter 
Bent — Atchison 20 interception return (Moehring kick), 3:42. 
Fourth quarter 
Bent — Mays-Hunt 13 pass from Ford (Moehring kick), 7:11. 
The Tigers (6-1, 3-1) sputtered for most of the first half and owned a 14-3 lead at halftime. Bentonville had nothing to show for its first two possessions, both of which started in Springdale territory as a result of a foiled fake punt attempt and a Logan Darby interception. 
"I'm not very pleased at all with the way we played offensively, to be completely honest," Bentonville coach Jody Grant said. "We're not doing like we talk about. We're not operating and doing things. 
"Quite frankly, if we don't get this fixed, we're in trouble." 
Bentonville didn't get on the scoreboard until Darby picked up his second interception at the Tigers 35. Kasey Ford then hit Kam'Ron Mays-Hunt nine plays later for the first of two touchdown passes, this one from 9 yards out with 10 minutes, 49 seconds before halftime. 
The Tigers' defense finished with three interceptions off Springdale quarterback Jack Lindsey, and took care of the scoring with the last one. Linebacker Brandon Atchison stepped in front of a Bulldog receiver to pick off Lindsey's pass and ran 20 yards for a score in the third quarter. 
"We couldn't get much going offensively," Springdale coach Zak Clark said. "I thought we were close at times. I thought the story was up front. They did a good job of minimizing our running game, which was kind of non-existent. 
"At times we played really well on offense, just not enough. We were close on some, but more than anything they're a good football team. That's what they do -- make things tough on you." 
Springdale (1-6, 1-3) made it 14-3 on John Bautista's 42-yard field goal with under a minute before halftime, and Jayden Minchew recovered an onside kick to start the second half. The Red'Dogs, however, had a holding penalty negate a 48-yard touchdown pass from Lindsey to Hunter Necessary, then they never threatened again.
